text: hey friends welcome to another episode
of so you want to travel the world Q&A
where you ask all of your travel
questions and I do my best to answer
them the first question comes from peace
Lovejoy 19 and he or she asks how do you
clean or dry your clothes when you
travel most of the time I can't wash my
clothes and I'll do it at a sink or a
tub or a bucket once in a while I'll
bring my clothes to a laundromat to get
a really good wash in a lot of countries
I've been able to find small little tiny
packages of tide to hand wash my clothes
and if not I'll just use you know
shampoo or bar soap and just scrub it
scrub scrub scrub and to dry them I'll
either hang them on furniture or on a
balcony or I always bring a rope with me
now so I can make a clothing line and
I've even used dental floss before it's
a clothing line and it actually worked
really well I was also given this when I
was in Hocking Hills and I have yet to
try it but maybe I should try it now
what do you think let's do it I've got
my bowl of water soap mini washboard and
I'm going to wash my I can't
believe I'm doing this in front of you
well I can so like I haven't peed in
front of you before and in case you
haven't seen that video you can watch it
right here it's actually pretty good
yeah I think I'm gonna bring this with
me on my next trip this next question
comes from Emily Wilcox how do you meet
people when you travel do you just go up
and start chatting to people but I'm
travelling I usually stay in hostels in
for many reasons because they're cheap
and it's a great place to meet other
travelers including a lot of solo
travelers most hostels offer daily
excursions for those staying there and
also night events like open mic or game
night this is a great way to meet other
travelers like yourself I've also met
people just walking around town or out
of cafe restaurant on a bus and it's
just about being friendly going up to
people introducing yourself and you
never know they may end up
your travel buddy and long-term friend
partial Blanca Pereira asks when did you
start to travel I started to travel and
I mean real travel hasn't immersed
myself in the culture was my first time
away from my family it was the first
time I really got a feel for the culture
the traditions and felt part of the
community and that was when I was 18 I
was an exchange program and I went to
Paraguay for four months and lived with
a host family taught English to
underprivileged children it was
incredible and since then I've been
hooked below so here I hope I said your
name right asked if I had to cancel five
destinations from those I've been to
what ones would I cancel I'm assuming
you mean which ones that I least liked
and that's really hard because I I'm not
I don't really I'm very open-minded and
if something's different or I don't
agree with something in another country
I don't just write it off I accept it
for what it is I find it very
interesting I like to try to understand
why people do things the way they do or
think the way they do so I really it's I
can't like there's no there's no
countries that I've been to where I
disliked it I've had bad situations
happen to me but it's all about how you
deal with them that kind of answers your
question Rebecca Levine asked a few
wonderful questions the first one is how
often do I leave and travel outside of
the US and Canada and that one's a
toughy because it varies for instance
right now I've had to stay in Toronto
the last couple of months because
there's been a lot of things happening
here and I had been working on a few
gigs next month I'm going to Curacao
nagas I am pretty sure I'm going to San
Diego and
in November I will be going to Mexico
and will probably be some other trips
planned here and there it all depends
and I mean last year I went on a trip
like every month and the year before
that I was gone for basically the entire
year it just it really depends I'm
trying to I'm trying this thing called
balance where I balance my acting career
and traveling and trying to eventually
combine them all together and it's been
going well so far I mean I love them
both so to have a balance of the two is
ideal to me Rebecca also asks how long
do I go for I have gone on trips that
have been ten months one month my few
months a few weeks one week it varies
but I would recommend at least going to
a country to really get a feel for it
for at least a month if you can like a
month or longer yeah another question
from Rebecca is since I don't like to
plan my trips how do I find places to
stay when I get there well I usually
just grab my bag from the airport and go
on a little adventure find a place
I usually just walk around the street
maybe I'll run into people and be like
hey do you know any good places to stay
around here usually I'll walk around and
check out a few places see if they're up
to my standards of you know a bed a
pillow a washroom even if it's shared
and door with a lock a walk we're in
town check out the area and if I if I
find a place that makes me feel
comfortable and excited and there's cool
people staying there then I will stay
there there's also always taxi drivers
outside of airports that will want to
take you to in place a hotel and hostel
and guest house whatever
that's because they get a commission on
it you know sometimes I've actually said
okay you know what take me take me where
you think I should stay and it's been
pretty decent other times I'm like get
me out of here now and another question
from Rebecca is do I plan things I want
to see and things I want to do in the
country before I leave and or do I just
kind of do it when I'm there and it's a
little bit above I mean I do like to do
a little bit of research to see where
I'm going and maybe what kind of
traditions they have or cool things to
do adventurous things to do I love
trying new things and if I can get some
ideas of things I've never tried and
that country offers it of course I want
to know where where where can I do it
how much is it gonna cost because I
really want to try new things I also
talked to friends have been to that
country and see if they have any
recommendations and also my fellow
bloggers I will always take the
recommendations because these guys know
what they're talking about but I always
leave myself open for any possibility
because I think that's that personally
to me is the best way to travel if you
leave yourself open to any possibility
you go with the flow then you're gonna
find yourself in places that you've
never imagined doing things you didn't
think you would do and really testing
your limits and it's pretty beautiful
it's a beautiful thing the beautiful
thing valera fire asked what's the best
way to get around different countries in
South America I would suggest taking a
bus if it's cheap is adventurous a
little bumpy a little scary unless
you're going from like the north of
South America to the south or vice versa
then you're probably going to want to
take a flight when I was traveling
throughout Peru actually took quite a
few flights within the country with Len
Peru and I was really impressed with the
airline they were affordable there was a
lot of room in the plane and the
customer service was excellent
beanbag traveler asks if it gets lonely
when I travel and if it's better to
travel with a friend or lover all of
those
options are great two choices I love
traveling solo and I've been in a
relationship for the past nine years and
I still love going off by myself I think
it's I think it's something that
everyone should try at least once in
their life and just to get a taste of it
you really learned a lot about yourself
what you like what you don't like and
you get to make your own decisions
without relying on other people's input
and I think it really helps you grow as
a person and as a traveler I'm kind of a
loner sometimes I and I really enjoy it
I love having my own time to myself and
I have a lot of fun I really do I mean I
have my camera with me all the time
which means I have you guys so I don't
really get lonely
I mean sometimes I'll miss my my my
lover and my family my friends but I
always use Skype to communicate with
them and see what they're up to and
Skype is great this guy is one of my
favorite things in the world because it
allows me to communicate and and and
have that person that's not physically
with me almost like they are with me
experiencing my travels so if I'm ever
missing someone I just Skyped them and
when I feel better but traveling with a
lover and friend is also really fun it's
nice to have someone there to share all
these experiences with there are times
where I I'm doing something and I just
want to look beside me like did you see
that or oh my god wasn't that incredible
and there's no one there but then that's
when I have you guys again am on camera
so it's like I'm never alone even though
I'm alone but I'm never alone and the
last question comes from Romeo Terrace
or Romeo that is I don't know
right Romeo Romeo wherefore art thou
Romeo Romeo asks how do I choose my
future destinations I've actually just
spun the globe once close my eyes and
put my finger on
wherever open my eyes and went to that
country that's actually how I went to
Ghana and ended up living there for a
couple of months and working in a TV
studio there's also just places that I I
just I'm fascinated with it I really
want to go there and learn about the
culture and maybe learn how to speak the
language and the food food is a big
thing as many of you know I like to eat
I need a lot in my videos so that's one
of the main reasons why I went to Italy
and Greece I've also been invited by
different tourism boards to go to
various countries which is pretty
friggin wicked I want to go everywhere
in this world if someone says hey you
want to go to Sudan yeah I do
hey you want to go to Australia ah yeah
Antarctica where's my coat let's go
thank you to everyone who submitted
these fantastic questions and if you yes
you have a question that you want to ask
feel free in a comment below you can
